education: Bachelor of Arts in History and Political Science (De La Salle University). Bachelor of Laws (Ateneo de Manila University)
career_timeline: Mayor, Mandaluyong City (Multiple terms). Chairman, MMDA (2021ÔøΩ2022). Secretary, DILG (June 2022 ÔøΩ Oct 2024). Party Affiliation: Partido Federal ng Pilipinas (PFP).
platforms_and_promises: "Buhay Ingatan, Droga'y Ayawan" (BIDA) Program: Holistic anti-drug campaign focusing on demand reduction, prevention, and rehabilitation at the local government unit (LGU) level. LGU Empowerment: Focus on strengthening LGUs' capacity to deliver effective basic services.
past_behaviors: PNP Mass Resignation Call (Jan 2023): Publicly urged all senior PNP officials to submit courtesy resignations to cleanse the police force of drug links, a major anti-corruption initiative during his DILG term.

education: Bachelor of Science in Biology (UP Diliman); Master of Science in Entomology (UP Los Ba√±os).
career_timeline: Entomologist; Professor (University of the Philippines Los Ba√±os); Researcher. Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayang Koalisyon ng Mamamayan (Makabayan).
platforms_and_promises: Environmental Protection and Food Security: Focus on sustainable agriculture, protecting natural resources, and using science-based policies to ensure food security. Genuine Agrarian Reform: Pushing for government subsidies and support for farmers and fisherfolk.
past_behaviors: Agricultural Science Advocacy: Has aligned his work as a scientist with progressive causes, advocating for local biodiversity and indigenous seed protection against commercial interests.

education: Background primarily as a media broadcaster, catechist, and advocate. Specific details on formal tertiary education are limited.
career_timeline: Media Broadcaster, Catechist, and Advocate. Candidate for Vice President (2022 National Elections) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Platforms focus generally on advocacy work. COMELEC noted his support was confined primarily to Northern Mindanao, which was one basis for their Nuisance Candidate ruling.
past_behaviors: Nuisance Candidate Case (2022): COMELEC declared him a nuisance candidate. The Supreme Court later issued a TRO and held COMELEC in contempt for procedural grave abuse of discretion, even though the case became moot after the elections.

education: Bachelor of Science in Nursing (Far Eastern University, cum laude, 1983).
career_timeline: Nurse and Health Activist. Secretary-General, Filipino Nurses United. Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayang Koalisyon ng Mamamayan (Makabayan).
platforms_and_promises: Healthcare Workers' Welfare: Vows to file for a $\text{‚Ç±50,000}$ monthly salary increase for nurses and $\text{‚Ç±33,000}$ for other healthcare workers. Public Healthcare: Advocating for better public health systems and opposing the privatization of government hospitals.
past_behaviors: Health Advocacy: Led campaigns against the privatization of major government hospitals (e.g., Philippine General Hospital) and criticized the government's proposal to exchange Filipino nurses for COVID-19 vaccines as treating them like commodities.

education: Bachelor of Science in Management Engineering (Ateneo de Manila University, summa cum laude, 1999).
career_timeline: Social Entrepreneur (Hapinoy Project). Senator of the Philippines (2013‚Äì2019). Chairman, Katipunan ng Nagkakaisang Pilipino (KANP) (2024-Present). Candidate for Senator (2025).
platforms_and_promises: Education: Principal sponsor of the Free College Education Act (RA 10931). Youth Employment & MSMEs: Principal author of the Go Negosyo Act (RA 10644). Focuses on increasing the national education budget and reforming K-12.
past_behaviors: Political Alignment: Currently co-leads the "KiBam" coalition (with Kiko Pangilinan) and is associated with the 2022 "pink wave" movement, focusing on reform-oriented politics, good governance, and democratic reforms.

education: Graduated from Janosa National High School. Briefly enrolled in a B.S. in Secondary Education program at the University of Rizal System and the University of Manila but did not complete a degree.
career_timeline: Fisherman; Barangay Kagawad (2013-2019); National Vice Chairperson, Pambansang Lakas ng Kilusang Mamamalakaya Pilipinas (PAMALAKAYA) (since 2023). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayang Koalisyon ng Mamamayan (Makabayan).
platforms_and_promises: Fisherfolk and Environmental Rights: Focus on opposing destructive reclamation projects (like Manila Bay), protecting marine habitats, and asserting fisherfolk's rights in the West Philippine Sea. Livelihood: Advocating for genuine fisheries and aquatic reforms.
past_behaviors: Grassroots Activism: Involved in grassroots campaigns since 2008 to amplify fisherfolk issues. His political focus is a direct continuation of his long-standing activism as a fisherfolk leader.

education: AB Political Science (Minor in Philosophy) and Bachelor of Laws (Baguio Colleges Foundation/University of the Cordilleras).
career_timeline: Labor Lawyer and Activist. Founding General Secretary, Kilusang Mayo Uno (KMU); Founding President, National Confederation of Labor (NCL). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Katipunan ng Kamalayang Kayumanggi (Katipunan).
platforms_and_promises: Labor Rights: Pushing for the Nationalization of Minimum Wage and the Criminalization of Contractualization (Endo). Social Issues: Advocates for land for informal settlers and supports the legalization of divorce and medical marijuana.
past_behaviors: Political Action: Through the NCL, he has actively filed petitions regarding election integrity, including asking COMELEC to verify the eligibility and citizenship of candidates (in the context of the Alice Guo issue).

education: High School: Buayan National High School. Attended various local and international trainings on marine resource management and environmental leadership. Profession: Fish Farmer/Fisherman.
career_timeline: Fisherman, Environmental Advocate, and Community Leader. Founder and Chairman, Kapunungan sa Gagmay'ng Mangingisda sa Concepcion (KGMC) (1986‚ÄìPresent). Ramon Magsaysay Awardee (2021). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Sustainable Fisheries and Marine Ecosystem Protection. Focuses on his platform of the "three Es" (Empowerment, Environment, and Economy). Advocates for enforcing maritime laws and expanding mangrove conservation efforts.
past_behaviors: Landmark Achievement: Received the 2021 Ramon Magsaysay Award for successfully leading his community in restoring over 500 hectares of mangroves and reviving the local fishing industry through sustainable practices.

education: Bachelor of Science in Human Ecology (UP Los Ba√±os). Juris Doctor (Law Degree) (Ateneo de Manila Law School); Admitted to the Philippine Bar.
career_timeline: Representative, Makati's 2nd District (2007‚Äì2016). Mayor of Makati City (2016 ‚Äì 2025, three terms). UN Advisory Group on Local and Regional Governments (2023‚ÄìPresent). Party affiliation: Nationalist People‚Äôs Coalition (NPC).
platforms_and_promises: Digitalization and Smart City: Implemented the Makatizen Card and Public Wi-Fi System. Climate Action: Focus on urban sustainability and climate resilience (served on the Global Covenant of Mayors Board).
past_behaviors: Infrastructure: Spearheaded the development of the Makati Subway project. Territorial Dispute: Vowed to protect residents and benefits in the 10 "Embo" barangays lost to Taguig after the Supreme Court ruling, though the matter is settled.

education: Bachelor of Arts in Communications (Ateneo de Manila University). Juris Doctor (Law Degree) (University of the East, completed in 2023).
career_timeline: Musician and Songwriter ("Let Me Be The One"). Vice President for CSR (PAGCOR, 2016‚Äì2021); Board of Directors Member (PAGCOR, 2021‚Äì2022). Candidate for Senator (2025) under PDP.
platforms_and_promises: Anti-Corruption and Governance: Platforms are strongly aligned with supporting and institutionalizing the anti-corruption and peace and order reforms of the previous administration. Health: Supports mandatory school feeding programs.
past_behaviors: Political Activism: A vocal supporter of the former President Rodrigo Duterte, writing songs and participating in pro-administration rallies. Appointed to the PAGCOR leadership after the 2016 elections.

education: Secondary Education (Fairfax High School, Los Angeles, California, 1982). Holds Honorary Doctorates in Public Administration and Humanities.
career_timeline: Governor of Cavite (1998‚Äì2001). Senator of the Philippines (2004‚Äì2016, 2019‚ÄìPresent). Party affiliation: Lakas-CMD.
platforms_and_promises: Disaster Resilience: Pushing to strengthen the National Building Code (SBN 2028), ensuring structures can withstand powerful earthquakes. Social Welfare: Authored the Expanded Centenarians Act and the Kabalikat sa Pagtuturo Act.
past_behaviors: PDAF Scandal: Charged with plunder in 2014; was acquitted by the Sandiganbayan (anti-graft court) in 2018. His legislative record focuses heavily on social services and disaster preparedness.

education: Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering (USeP). Master in Management (Development Academy of the Philippines).
career_timeline: Retired Police Colonel (PNP Highway Patrol Group). Representative, 1-Rider Partylist (2022‚Äì2025). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Road Safety and Motorcyclist Rights: Advocating for clear, unambiguous, and fair traffic laws to protect motorcycle riders. Governance: Focus on fighting corruption among traffic enforcers and ensuring public accountability.
past_behaviors: Public Activism: Gained significant public support through his social media advocacy (as Colonel Bosita, RSAP), where he publicly challenged and disputed arbitrary traffic violations.

education: Bachelor of Arts in Philippine Studies (UP Diliman). Taught Philippine Literature, Humanities, and Science.
career_timeline: Educator; Child Rights Activist. Representative, Gabriela Women's Party-list (2016‚Äì2025, part of the Makabayan bloc). House Deputy Minority Leader.
platforms_and_promises: Women‚Äôs and Children's Rights: Co-author of the SOGIE Equality Bill and the Magna Carta for Daycare Workers. Economic Justice: Filed bills seeking a Super-Rich Tax (HB 258), increased wages for teachers, and the repeal of the Anti-Terrorism Act.
past_behaviors: Legislative Consistency: Known for her consistent anti-administration stance and strong advocacy for progressive causes such as labor contractualization (anti-endo bill) and human rights defense.

education: Bachelor of Science in Community Development (UP Diliman); Master of Arts in Public Administration (National College of Public Administration and Governance).
career_timeline: Community Development Specialist; Environmental Activist; Candidate for Senator (2025) under the Democratic Party of the Philippines (DPP).
platforms_and_promises: Climate Justice and Environmental Protection: Focus on climate change mitigation, sustainable development, and demanding accountability from polluters. Energy Transition: Advocates for a full shift to non-nuclear renewable energy.
past_behaviors: Development Work: Over 25 years of experience in development work, aligning with socialist and environmental causes. He ran as part of the Leody de Guzman senatorial slate in 2022.

education: Philippine Military Academy (PMA) ‚ÄúMatikas‚Äù Class of 1983.
career_timeline: Colonel (Retired). Executive Director, NTF-ELCAC (2018‚Äì2022). Chairperson, NCIP (2019‚Äì2023). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Partido Pilipino sa Pagbabago.
platforms_and_promises: Indigenous Peoples' (IP) Rights and Counter-Insurgency: Focus on strengthening the IPRA and advancing development in IP communities, largely through the framework of the anti-insurgency campaign.
past_behaviors: Controversial Allegations: Linked to the "Hello Garci" scandal (2005) and a Bureau of Customs corruption scandal (2017) (nicknamed "Big Brother" in reports), which he has denied. His tenure at NCIP was marked by intense criticism from human rights groups regarding red-tagging of IP leaders.

education: Bachelor of Arts in Sociology (University of the Philippines Los Ba√±os, 1993).
career_timeline: Journalist and Activist. Representative, Bayan Muna Party-list (2004‚Äì2013). Chairperson, Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (BAYAN) (Incumbent). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayan.
platforms_and_promises: Economic Justice: Main advocacy is lowering prices of electricity, oil, and basic utilities. Filed bills for the removal of VAT on power (HB 2719) and oil (HB 1630). Governance: Principal author of the Whistleblowers Protection Bill and the Freedom of Information Bill (HB 133).
past_behaviors: Legislative Record: Prolific bill filer (4th most in the 15th Congress) with key laws authored including the Tax Relief Act of 2009 (exempting minimum wage earners from tax) and the Anti-Torture Act of 2009. Current Events: Involved in filing the impeachment complaint against Vice President Sara Duterte in December 2024.

education: Bachelor of Science in Education (Major in Mathematics) ‚Äì Philippine Normal University (PNU), cum laude. Master of Science in Mathematics Education (Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila).
career_timeline: Teacher (former); Trade Union Activist. Representative, ACT Party-list (2016‚Äì2025). House Deputy Minority Leader (2022‚Äì2025). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayan.
platforms_and_promises: Teacher and Workers' Welfare: Pushes to raise public school teachers' basic salaries to $\text{‚Ç±50,000}$ and the national minimum wage to $\text{‚Ç±33,000}$. Education Support: Co-authored the Kabalikat sa Pagtuturo Act, which raises teachers' allowances to $\text{‚Ç±10,000}$ starting 2025.
past_behaviors: Legislative Record: Co-authored the New Agrarian Emancipation Act (RA 11953). Led teachers' campaigns for better pay and benefits, resulting in the issuance of a DepEd order compensating teachers for work overload (April 2024).

education: Bachelor of Arts in Economics (UP Diliman, cum laude). Bachelor of Laws (UP College of Law, 7th in class).
career_timeline: Senator of the Philippines (2004‚Äì2016, 2019‚ÄìPresent). Representative, 2nd District of Taguig (2016‚Äì2019). Chair, Senate Blue Ribbon Committee (2024‚ÄìPresent). Party affiliation: Nacionalista Party.
platforms_and_promises: Health and Women's Rights: Principal author of landmark laws: Responsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Act, Expanded Breastfeeding Promotion Act, and Expanded Senior Citizens Act. Fiscal Reform: Authored and sponsored the CREATE Act and the POGO Law.
past_behaviors: International Role: First Filipino and Asian to head the IPU Committee of Women Parliamentarians (2008). Current Role: As Blue Ribbon Chair, led hearings into sensitive issues, including the previous administration's war on drugs (Oct 2024).

education: Lawyer; Educator (Professor, University of Santo Tomas - UST Law).
career_timeline: Litigation Lawyer; Educator; Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Legal and Social Reform: Pushing for amendments to the Family Code to be inclusive of same-sex relationships. Advocates for judicial funding and policies for persons with disabilities (PWDs). Election Reform: Aims to level the playing field for independent and non-traditional candidates.
past_behaviors: Nuisance Candidate Ruling (2019): Challenged the COMELEC's decision to label him a nuisance candidate due to perceived lack of financial capacity and machinery, a case that became moot but highlighted the financial barrier for independent national candidates.

education: Bachelor of Science in Accountancy (Fernandez Colleges in Baliuag, Bulacan).
career_timeline: Environmental Advocate; Social Reformist. National President, Green Party of the Philippines. Candidate for Senator (2025) under Bunyog Pagkakaisa Party.
platforms_and_promises: Environmental Sustainability: Focus on addressing climate change, protecting natural resources, and holding polluters accountable. Governance Reforms: Vows a "zero-budget" campaign and is critical of the use of government aid (e.g., AKAP, AICS) for political gain.
past_behaviors: Political Affiliation: Previously ran under the Partido Lakas ng Masa (PLM) in 2022. Known for taking a strong stance on sensitive political issues, including commenting on the impeachment of VP Sara Duterte and the ICC probe.

education: Bachelor of Science in Customs Administration (Philippine Maritime Institute - PMI Colleges).
career_timeline: Labor Leader and Activist. Chairman, Bukluran ng Manggagawang Pilipino (BMP) (2018‚ÄìPresent). Candidate for President (2022) and Candidate for Senator (2025) under Partido Lakas ng Masa (PLM).
platforms_and_promises: Labor Rights: Advocates for $\text{‚Ç±750}$ National Minimum Wage and abolishing contractualization ("endo"). Systemic Change: Supports taxing the wealthy, genuine agrarian reform, and the abolition of political dynasties (a key platform in his 2025 Senate bid).
past_behaviors: Political Stance: Known for advocating for the overhaul of the political system, including the resignation of all elected officials during EDSA II. Consistently rejects "transactional politics" and military agreements with the U.S.

education: Philippine Military Academy (PMA) ‚ÄúSinagtala‚Äù Class of 1986. Ph.D. in Development Administration (University of Southeastern Philippines, 2006).
career_timeline: Chief of the Philippine National Police (PNP) (2016‚Äì2018). Senator of the Philippines (2019‚ÄìPresent). Party affiliation: PDP-Laban.
platforms_and_promises: Peace and Order: Priority legislation includes the revival and imposition of the death penalty for high-level drug crimes (SB No. 226). Police Reform: Authored the PNP, BFP, BJMP, and BuCor Height Equality Act (RA 11549).
past_behaviors: ICC Probe: Led the controversial "War on Drugs" under Duterte, making him a subject of an International Criminal Court (ICC) investigation for alleged crimes against humanity. Reports of a possible ICC arrest warrant were made public in November 2025, but the status is monitored by the DOJ.

education: Background primarily as a peasant advocate and grassroots leader; often cited as a paralegal.
career_timeline: Peasant and Urban Poor Advocate. Secretary-General, Amihan Federation of Peasant Women. Leader, Kalipunan ng Damayang Mahihirap (KADAMAY). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayan.
platforms_and_promises: Land Reform: Pushing for genuine agrarian reform and the free distribution of land to farmers and indigenous peoples. Food Security: Advocates for government subsidies for local farmers and opposition to the privatization of agricultural resources.
past_behaviors: Activism: A prominent figure in the KADAMAY movement, known for advocating for the rights of the urban poor to housing and the rights of peasant women against militarization and land grabbing.

education: Philippine Military Academy (PMA) Graduate (1979).
career_timeline: Retired Police General (Served in the Philippine Constabulary and PNP Intelligence Group). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Partido Maharlika.
platforms_and_promises: Governance and Social Services: Focus on good governance, livelihood, and healthcare. Supports free education and the expansion of universal healthcare coverage. Legal Reform: Supports expanding VAWC laws to include LGBTIQ+ relationships.
past_behaviors: Military/Police Service: His career included being involved in a 1990 shooting incident that led to a legal case where he argued the Sandiganbayan had exclusive jurisdiction (a case that reached the Supreme Court).

education: Bachelor of Arts in Communication Arts (Ateneo de Manila University). Doctor of Jurisprudence (Law) (Ateneo de Manila University).
career_timeline: Labor Leader and Lawyer. President, Bukluran ng Manggagawang Pilipino (BMP). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Partido Lakas ng Masa (PLM).
platforms_and_promises: Labor Rights: Advocates for significant wage increases and abolishing contractualization. Social Issues: Publicly supports legalization of divorce, same-sex marriage, and reproductive rights including access to abortion. Political Reform: Campaigns against political dynasties and "trapos" (traditional politicians).
past_behaviors: Public Engagements: Gained significant public attention during the 2022 senatorial debates for his fiery and principled exchanges, particularly on the issues of the Marcos family's ill-gotten wealth and Martial Law.

education: Background as a transport leader and activist. Completed high school and gained practical experience in the transport sector.
career_timeline: FX Driver (former); President, Pagkakaisa ng mga Samahan ng Tsuper at Opereytor Nationwide (PISTON). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayang Koalisyon ng Mamamayan (Makabayan).
platforms_and_promises: Transport Rights: Leading the opposition to the Jeepney Phaseout/Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program (PUVMP). Economic Justice: Advocates for the repeal of the Oil Deregulation Law (RA 8479) and the TRAIN Law, demanding the removal of high taxes (VAT, excise tax) on fuel to lower transport costs.
past_behaviors: Activism: Led numerous nationwide transport strikes and protests to defend the livelihood of jeepney drivers and operators. His candidacy is positioned as a direct challenge to the political dynasty system.

education: Background as a Political Vlogger/Commentator. Specific formal education details not prominently highlighted in current campaign materials.
career_timeline: Political Vlogger and Social Media Personality. Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Combating Misinformation: Proposes the creation of a "24/7 fake news monitoring office" to actively combat misinformation and disinformation, particularly on social media platforms. Governance: Expressed frustration with the government, leading him to seek a Senate seat to enact change directly.
past_behaviors: Media Presence: Built a large following as an online political commentator, using his platform to voice concerns and critique government actions. Positions himself as someone who believes there is "good in every political faction."

education: Bachelor of Arts in Economics (De La Salle University).
career_timeline: Special Assistant to the President (2016‚Äì2018). Senator of the Philippines (2019‚ÄìPresent). Party affiliation: PDP-Laban.
platforms_and_promises: Healthcare: Principal author of the Malasakit Center Act (RA 11463). Focuses on establishing Super Health Centers and Regional Specialty Centers to bring healthcare services closer to the people. Disaster Resilience: Pushing for the creation of the Department of Disaster Resilience (DDR).
past_behaviors: Legislative Focus: Principally sponsored 69 laws for the upgrade or establishment of public hospitals. He strongly advocates for a brand of public service centered on health and assistance, stemming from his long career as the aide to former President Rodrigo Duterte.

education: Pre-medicine Course (Ateneo de Davao).
career_timeline: National Security Adviser (2005‚Äì2007). Secretary of National Defense (OIC, 2009‚Äì2010). Candidate for President (2022). Chairperson, Partido Demokratiko Sosyalista ng Pilipinas (PDSP). Candidate for Senator (2025).
platforms_and_promises: Social Democracy: Platforms are rooted in social democratic principles, focusing on internal development, governance strategy, and addressing systemic issues. Food Security: Stresses the reform of the Department of Agriculture and making food production a national priority (a major platform point in 2022 that he continues to advocate).
past_behaviors: Anti-Martial Law Activism: Co-organized the movement that became the PDSP, which worked with the MNLF to overthrow Marcos. He was a key figure in the Arroyo administration, though he was once detained by the Senate for contempt of Congress (2005).

education: Lawyer; Alma Mater includes University of Negros Occidental ‚Äì Recoletos and University of Santo Tomas.
career_timeline: Undersecretary, DILG (2016‚Äì2017). Commissioner, Presidential Anti-Corruption Commission (PACC) (2022). Deputy Secretary General for Visayas, PDP-Laban (2023‚ÄìPresent). Candidate for Senator (2025) under PDP-Laban.
platforms_and_promises: Anti-Corruption and Governance: Platforms focus on strengthening anti-corruption bodies and accountability. Patriotism & Education: Advocates for introducing a subject called ‚ÄúPhilippine Patriotism and Ethic Studies‚Äù from Grade 1 to college to foster good and patriotic citizens.
past_behaviors: Duterte Supporter: Was part of the "Marco Polo 15" that promoted Rodrigo Duterte's presidential bid in 2016. Served in several appointed positions during the Duterte administration.

education: Philippine Military Academy (PMA) ‚ÄúMatatag‚Äù Class of 1971 (cum laude).
career_timeline: Former Army Colonel (leader of RAM); Senator of the Philippines (1995‚Äì2004, 2007‚Äì2019). Secretary, DICT (2019‚Äì2021). Leader, Reform PH - People's Party (since June 2024). Candidate for Senator (2025).
platforms_and_promises: Reformism and New Politics: His new party, Reform PH, aims for reformism and a new brand of politics. Security: The party has proposed the establishment of paramilitary groups to enforce sovereignty claims in the West Philippine Sea. Integrity: Focus on integrity in public service and environmental protection.
past_behaviors: Military Coups: A key figure in the 1986 EDSA Revolution and subsequently led several bloody coup attempts against President Corazon Aquino. Legal Issues: Charged with graft over the PDAF (Pork Barrel) scam in 2017.

education: Specific details on formal tertiary education are limited in public records.
career_timeline: Candidate for Senator (multiple elections, including 2025) under Kilusang Bagong Lipunan (KBL). The KBL is the political party that served as the vehicle for the former President Ferdinand E. Marcos.
platforms_and_promises: Party Ideology: As a candidate under KBL, his platform aligns with the party's ideology of Conservatism, Anti-communism, Filipino Nationalism, and Economic Nationalism. Platforms generally support policies associated with the New Society era.
past_behaviors: Electoral History: Has consistently run for the Senate as a KBL candidate, often under the banner of a larger coalition supporting the Marcos family.

education: Philippine Military Academy (PMA) ‚ÄúMatatag‚Äù Class of 1971.
career_timeline: Director General, PNP (1999‚Äì2001). Senator of the Philippines (2001‚Äì2013, 2016‚Äì2022). President Pro Tempore (Sept 2025 ‚Äì Present). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Anti-Corruption and Fiscalizer: Vows to remain an independent fiscalizer in the Senate. Focus on scrutinizing the National Budget, questioning inequitable or distorted allocations (e.g., in flood control). Security: Co-authored the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 (RA 11479) and the National ID Law (RA 11055).
past_behaviors: Budgetary Scrutiny: Known for exposing "pork" and questionable insertions in the national budget. Police Career: Led the Presidential Anti-Organized Crime Task Force (PAOCTF), where he gained a reputation for being tough on crime.

education: AB Political Science (cum laude), Bachelor of Laws (valedictorian, cum laude) ‚Äì University of Pangasinan.
career_timeline: Lawyer and Law Professor. Administrator and CEO, Cagayan Economic Zone Authority (CEZA) (2017‚Äì2022). Candidate for Senator (2025) under PDP-Laban.
platforms_and_promises: Food Security: His main campaign platform is "Pagkain sa Bawat Pinggan" (Food on Every Plate), aiming to strengthen food security programs and policies. Constitutional Reform: Known for his long-standing advocacy for Charter Change.
past_behaviors: Charter Change Advocacy: Led the controversial 2005 signature campaign to amend the Constitution through a people's initiative (which the Supreme Court ultimately denied). Served as a political appointee under President Rodrigo Duterte.

education: Did not pursue tertiary education; entered the film industry as a stuntman.
career_timeline: Actor. Governor of Pampanga (1995‚Äì2004). Senator of the Philippines (2004‚Äì2016, 2019‚ÄìPresent). Party affiliation: Nationalist People‚Äôs Coalition (NPC).
platforms_and_promises: Social Welfare: Authored the Free Legal Assistance Act of 2010 and the Expanded Senior Citizens Act of 2010. Film Industry: Supports allocating funds for loans to local film producers and lowering taxes on film theaters.
past_behaviors: Legislative Focus: Despite having little formal education, he is recognized for being a productive legislator, often focusing on measures that benefit the masses (masa), such as legal aid and consumer protection (Meat Labeling Act).

education: Representative for AGRI Partylist since 2022.
career_timeline: Representative, AGRI Partylist (2022‚ÄìPresent). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Aksyon Demokratiko (The candidacy was WITHDRAWN in February 2025).
past_behaviors: Reason for Withdrawal: Cited lack of time and sufficient political machinery to mount a successful nationwide campaign as the primary reasons for his withdrawal, choosing instead to focus on the AGRI Partylist's re-election bid.

education: Bachelor of Arts in Journalism (UP Diliman).
career_timeline: Moro and Indigenous Peoples (IP) Activist. Co-chairperson, Sandugo-Movement of Moro and Indigenous Peoples for Self-Determination. Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayang Koalisyon ng Mamamayan (Makabayan).
platforms_and_promises: Moro and IP Rights: Focus on the right to self-determination for Moro and indigenous peoples. Justice: Pushing for compensation for victims of the Marawi Siege and the protection of human rights defenders. Anti-Imperialism: Vows to be vocal against foreign military intervention and its impact on Mindanao.
past_behaviors: Activism: Active since her student days as National Chairperson of the National Union of Students of the Philippines (NUSP). Was instrumental in forming the Moro-Christian People's Alliance.

education: Bachelor of Laws (San Sebastian College). Master in Business Administration (University of the East).
career_timeline: Lawyer; Representative, SAGIP Party-list (2016‚Äì2025). Senator of the Philippines (2025‚ÄìPresent). Elected Senator in the 2025 elections. Party affiliation: Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Governance and Anti-Corruption: Platform is built around integrity in government. Affiliations: His campaign was strongly affiliated with the "DuterTen" senatorial slate and received formal endorsement from the Iglesia ni Cristo (INC).
past_behaviors: Legislative Role: Known for his vigorous cross-examinations and strong defense of the Duterte administration's policies in the House. Controversy: Gained national attention for his role in opposing the franchise renewal of ABS-CBN.

education: Attended Princeton University and UP Diliman, but did not obtain an undergraduate degree from either institution, according to official statements.
career_timeline: Governor of Ilocos Norte (2010‚Äì2019). Senator of the Philippines (2019‚ÄìPresent). Sister of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. Party affiliation: Nacionalista Party (NP).
platforms_and_promises: Youth and Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW) Welfare: Focuses on job creation, digital infrastructure, and support for returning OFWs. Economic Stimulus: Proponent of the Universal Basic Income (SB 1891) and the Expanded Free Legal Assistance Act (SB 1892).
past_behaviors: Martial Law Association: Served as Chairman of the Kabataang Barangay during her father's regime. She has been consistently criticized for martial law denialism and for the false claims made about her educational background.

education: Resident of Mountain Province; Occupation: Real Estate Broker.
career_timeline: Co-founder/Administrator, Baguio Animal Welfare (BAW). Candidate for Senator (2019, 2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Animal Welfare and Marginalized: Aims to be the "voice of animals" and the marginalized in the Senate. Social Reform: Supports creating education policies to protect women, LGBTQI+, and youth, and the expansion of free legal assistance for victims of VAWC and cybercrimes.
past_behaviors: Nuisance Candidate Ruling (2019): COMELEC declared him a nuisance candidate due to a lack of perceived financial capacity for a nationwide campaign, a ruling he challenged by arguing for the power of social media and donor support to wage a cost-effective, "revolutionary" campaign.

education: Attended University of Santo Tomas (B.S. in Commerce, major in Business Administration, unfinished).
career_timeline: Representative, Valenzuela's 2nd District (2016‚Äì2025). House Deputy Speaker (2020‚Äì2022). Vice Mayor, Valenzuela City (2007‚Äì2016). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Local Governance: Focuses on leveraging his experience in local and legislative governance. Although running as an Independent in the Senate bid, he remains a Vice President for Luzon of the Partido Demokratiko Pilipino (PDP).
past_behaviors: Controversial Vote: Voted to reject the franchise renewal of ABS-CBN in 2020. Denies the label of "political butterfly" despite having switched parties (from Lakas‚ÄìCMD to Liberal Party to PDP-Laban) during his career, citing circumstantial necessity.

education: Doctor of Medicine (M.D.) (Davao Medical School Foundation, 1997). Diplomate National Board. Occupation: Pediatrician and Vlogger.
career_timeline: Physician (Good Shepherd Hospital); Vlogger (Nickname: Pambansang Marites na Doktor). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent (later joined the Duterten slate).
platforms_and_promises: Children's Welfare and Healthcare: Focus on improving children's welfare and pushing for a wholistic approach in providing medical services. Specifically raised the issue of late diagnosis of children with disabilities due to bureaucracy.
past_behaviors: Political Dynasty Stance: Has publicly stated he believes there are "good political dynasties" and that banning them entirely should not be done, arguing "leadership is genetic." He is the nephew of Senator Bong Go.

education: AB Political Science (Mindanao State University). Bachelor of Laws (Manuel L. Quezon University).
career_timeline: Labor Leader and Lawyer. President, Federation of Free Workers (FFW). Chairperson, Nagkaisa Labor Coalition. Candidate for Senator (2019, 2022, 2025) under Workers‚Äô and Peasants‚Äô Party (WPP).
platforms_and_promises: Labor Rights: Advocates for stricter enforcement of the Labor Code by increasing penalties for violations (e.g., raising fines from $\text{‚Ç±1,000}$ to $\text{‚Ç±50,000}$). Focuses on decent jobs with living wages and institutionalizing scholarships for children of workers and peasants.
past_behaviors: Government Experience: Served as Executive Director V of the Presidential Anti-Graft Commission (2001‚Äì2002) and as a Commissioner of the SSS (2006‚Äì2010). Has consistently run on a labor-focused, progressive platform.

education: Bachelor of Science in Business Economics (UP Diliman, 1978).
career_timeline: Activist and Politician. Representative, Gabriela Women's Party (2004‚Äì2010). Lead Convenor, National Anti-Poverty Commission (NAPC) (2016‚Äì2018). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayan.
platforms_and_promises: Social Justice and Women‚Äôs Rights: Principal author of landmark laws like the Anti-Violence in Women and Children Act (RA 9262) and the Magna Carta of Women (RA 9710). Foreign Policy: Pushes for an independent foreign policy and the removal of U.S. bases in the Philippines.
past_behaviors: Activism and Legislative Record: Authored or co-authored major social laws including the Juvenile Justice and Welfare Act and the Anti-Torture Law. Current Action: Involved in filing the impeachment complaint against VP Sara Duterte (Dec 2024).

education: B.S. in Accountancy (Sacred Heart College of Lucena City). Master in Public Administration (UP Diliman). Master in National Security Administration (NDCP). Certified Public Accountant (CPA).
career_timeline: Commissioner, Commission on Audit (COA) (2011‚Äì2015). Under-Secretary-General, UN Office of Internal Oversight Services (OIOS) (2015‚Äì2019). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Anti-Corruption: Main platform is fighting corruption based on her nearly three decades in audit. Fiscal Accountability: Advocates for budget literacy through legislation to educate citizens on government financial activities. Supports the abolishment of all forms of pork barrel funding.
past_behaviors: Whistleblower: Gained national prominence as the whistleblower in the 2011 Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) corruption scandal, exposing the misuse and diversion of military funds, which led to her receiving death threats.

education: Doctor of Medicine (M.D.) (Far Eastern University). Bachelor of Laws (LL.B.) (Philippine Law School). Cardiologist and Lawyer.
career_timeline: Practicing Cardiologist and Lawyer. Legal Counsel, Philippine Heart Center. Candidate for President (2022). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Health and OFW Welfare: Focuses on providing legal and medical assistance to Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs). Law and Order: Advocates for removing the controversial aspects of Oplan Tokhang and addressing the issue of drugs through other means.
past_behaviors: Controversial Claims: During the 2022 presidential debates, he made unverified claims about COVID-19 vaccines. Electoral History: Has run for various positions (Governor, Representative, President) but has consistently garnered low votes, although he campaigns on limited personal funds.

education: Background as a social advocate. Specific details on tertiary education are limited.
career_timeline: Advocate for Workers and Urban Poor. Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Labor Rights: Advocates for the end of contractualization ("endo") to allow workers to form or join unions. Healthcare: Proposes strengthening the national healthcare system and providing higher salaries for healthcare professionals to mitigate brain drain.
past_behaviors: Social Stance: In forums, he stated he is not against civil unions for LGBTIQ+ couples but would not favor marriage for them, generally supporting the integrated development of the urban poor, farmers, and workers.

education: Doctor of Medicine (M.D.) (UP Manila, 1987). M.D. specializing in Cardiology and Internal Medicine.
career_timeline: Public Health Advocate and Vlogger (Dr. Willie Ong); Candidate for Vice President (2022). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Aksyon Demokratiko (Candidacy WITHDRAWN in February 2025).
past_behaviors: Public Health Education: Built a massive social media following (over 17 million on Facebook) by providing free, accessible health advice. Reason for Withdrawal: Officially withdrew from the 2025 Senate race due to health concerns, stating he needed to focus on his own well-being.

education: Professional Boxer (former); Bachelor of Arts in Political Science (University of Makati, 2019).
career_timeline: Member of the House of Representatives (Sarangani, 2010‚Äì2016). Senator of the Philippines (2016‚Äì2022). Candidate for President (2022). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Partido Federal ng Pilipinas (PFP).
platforms_and_promises: Anti-Corruption and Housing: Main platform is fighting corruption, which he calls the "cancer of the country." Promises to resume his efforts on nationwide housing projects for the poor, a key platform from his previous bids.
past_behaviors: Legislative Record: Focused on sports development and public works during his first Senate term. Political Affiliation: Officially ran under the PFP in 2025, which is aligned with the Alyansa para sa Bagong Pilipinas coalition.

education: Bachelor of Arts in English (UP Diliman). Master in Public Administration (Harvard University, John F. Kennedy School of Government).
career_timeline: Senator of the Philippines (2001‚Äì2013, 2016‚Äì2022). Vice Presidential Candidate (2022). Chairperson, Liberal Party (LP). Candidate for Senator (2025) under LP.
platforms_and_promises: Food Security and Agriculture: Focuses on lowering the prices of rice and other basic goods. Vows to fully implement the Sagip Saka Act (RA 11321), which he authored, to improve farmers' market access. Legislative Review: Called for a review of the Rice Tariffication Law (RTL) to assess its impact on small farmers.
past_behaviors: Electoral History: Known for his consistent focus on agriculture and justice reform (authored the Juvenile Justice and Welfare Act). Was re-elected to the Senate in 2025, placing fifth, defying initial low survey numbers.

education: Philippine Military Academy (PMA) ‚ÄúMatikas‚Äù Class of 1983. Colonel (Retired, Philippine Marine Corps).
career_timeline: Decorated Marine Officer. Candidate for Senator (2025) under the Nacionalista Party (NP), running as part of the "Riding-in-Tandem Team" slate.
platforms_and_promises: National Security and Sovereignty: Focuses on defending the country's sovereignty, particularly in the West Philippine Sea. Advocates for officials who are "ready to die for the Philippines." Governance: Aims to bring military discipline and integrity to the Senate.
past_behaviors: Military Involvement: Received the Medal of Valor for gallantry in action. Was a leader in the 2006 Marine standoff at the Marine headquarters in Fort Bonifacio, which challenged the government.

education: Religious Leader and Televangelist. Founder of the Kingdom of Jesus Christ (KJC).
career_timeline: Religious Leader (self-proclaimed "Appointed Son of God"). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Governance and Morality: Platform centers on moral governance, peace and order, and advancing his religious advocacies. He was adopted by the DuterTen slate.
past_behaviors: Legal Status: Currently detained and facing multiple criminal charges, including qualified human trafficking and child abuse in the Philippines, as well as an active extradition request from the U.S. His candidacy was challenged before the Supreme Court by the Workers‚Äô and Peasants‚Äô Party (WPP) due to his legal status.

education: Background as a labor union leader and activist for workers' rights.
career_timeline: General Secretary, Kilusang Mayo Uno (KMU); Vice Chairperson, Makabayan Coalition. Candidate for Senator (2025) under Makabayang Koalisyon ng Mamamayan (Makabayan).
platforms_and_promises: Labor and Wages: Advocates for a National Minimum Wage and the implementation of a social protection program for workers, including higher benefits and mandatory hazard pay for essential workers. Human Rights: Focuses on defending trade union rights and opposition to the Anti-Terrorism Act.
past_behaviors: Activism: A prominent figure in the militant labor movement, consistently leading campaigns and protests for workers' welfare, including major strikes against contractualization and low wages.

education: Did not pursue a degree after high school; TV Host, Actor, and Comedian by profession.
career_timeline: Popular Television Host (of Wowowee, Wowowin, and Wil To Win). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: "Serbisyo at Puso" (Service and Heart): His platform emphasizes direct public service and aid based on his experience giving away cash and prizes on his TV shows. Legislative Stance: Admitted of not having a detailed legislative platform at the time of his candidacy filing, stating that a "good heart" and dedication to countrymen is enough for a senator.
past_behaviors: Political Affiliation: Though running as an Independent, he was a vocal supporter of the former President Rodrigo Duterte and was asked to run in the 2022 elections (which he declined). Electoral Outcome: Despite topping some pre-election surveys, he lost the 2025 Senate election, placing 22nd in the final official results.

education: Bachelor of Laws (University of Santo Tomas, 2005). Certified Public Accountant (CPA).
career_timeline: Lawyer; Executive Secretary (June 2022 ‚Äì Sept 2022). Chief of Staff to former President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. (Oct 2022 ‚Äì March 2023). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Governance and Anti-Corruption: Focuses on good governance and bureaucratic efficiency, leveraging his experience in the Executive branch. Economic Policy: Advocates for attracting foreign investment and streamlining business regulations.
past_behaviors: Controversial Resignation: Resigned as Executive Secretary after a short tenure following controversies, including the sugar importation fiasco (Sugar Order No. 4). He continues to be a close ally of the President.

education: Bachelor of Science in Education (Sulu College of Technology). Master in Public Administration (Notre Dame of Jolo College).
career_timeline: Governor of Sulu (1996‚Äì2001). Vice Governor of Sulu (2007‚Äì2010). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Peace and Development in Mindanao: Focuses on bringing lasting peace and economic development to the Bangsamoro region and Sulu. Women's Empowerment: Advocates for the rights of women, especially in Muslim Mindanao.
past_behaviors: Political Dynasty: Part of the powerful Sahidulla political family in Sulu. Known for her focus on human rights issues affecting the region during her political career.

education: Actor, Director, and Producer.
career_timeline: Veteran Film Actor. Candidate for Senator (2025) under PDP-Laban.
platforms_and_promises: Anti-Drug and Anti-Crime: Focus on strengthening peace and order, including rehabilitation programs for drug users. Film Industry: Advocates for measures to support the local film industry and protect artists' welfare.
past_behaviors: Political Alignment: A long-time and vocal supporter of former President Rodrigo Duterte. Known for his action star roles in films.

education: Bachelor of Arts in Criminology (University of the East).
career_timeline: Governor of Ilocos Sur (Multiple terms, 1972‚Äì2019). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent (Candidacy WITHDRAWN in January 2025).
past_behaviors: Witness in Estrada Impeachment: Became a key figure in Philippine political history when he accused then-President Joseph Estrada of receiving millions from illegal gambling (jueteng), triggering Estrada's impeachment. Reason for Withdrawal: Withdrew to focus on his gubernatorial run in Ilocos Sur.

education: Bachelor of Arts in English (Ateneo de Manila University).
career_timeline: Senator of the Philippines (1992‚Äì2004, 2010‚Äì2022). Senate President (2018‚Äì2022). Candidate for Vice President (2022). Candidate for Senator (2025) under Nationalist People‚Äôs Coalition (NPC).
platforms_and_promises: Anti-Drug and Crime: Principal author of the Comprehensive Dangerous Drugs Act of 2002 (RA 9165). Governance: Focuses on strengthening the country's fiscal management and ensuring the strict implementation of existing laws.
past_behaviors: Legislative Leadership: Known for his roles as Senate Majority Leader and Senate President, where he championed fiscal responsibility and peace-and-order legislation. Media Career: A prominent figure in the entertainment industry (Eat Bulaga!).

education: Background as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and social advocate.
career_timeline: OFW Advocate; Candidate for Senator (2025) under Partido Maharlika.
platforms_and_promises: OFW Welfare: Platform is centered on creating better support systems and protection for OFWs, addressing issues like illegal recruitment and unfair labor practices abroad. Social Welfare: Focuses on basic social services and poverty reduction.
past_behaviors: Campaign Strategy: Positions himself as a non-traditional candidate representing the struggles of the working class and OFWs.

education: Bachelor of Laws (Ateneo de Manila University). Master of Laws (University of London and the University of Michigan).
career_timeline: Mayor of Tagaytay City (1995‚Äì2004). Chairman, MMDA (2010‚Äì2015). Senator of the Philippines (2019‚ÄìPresent). Party affiliation: Partido Federal ng Pilipinas (PFP).
platforms_and_promises: Local Governance and Disaster Risk Reduction: Principal author of the Department of Disaster Resilience Act and the Mandatory Establishment of Local Youth Development Offices Act (RA 11776). Constitutional Reform: Proponent of revising the 1987 Constitution to strengthen local autonomy.
past_behaviors: Public Service Record: Known for his strict implementation of traffic rules as MMDA Chairman. His legislative focus is heavily tied to his background in local governance and disaster management.

education: Journalist and Broadcaster.
career_timeline: Media Personality and Broadcaster (host of Bitag). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Peace and Order: Platforms center on a tough stance against crime and corruption, mirroring the advocacy of his media program, Bitag. OFW Protection: Focus on protecting marginalized sectors, including OFWs and victims of injustice.
past_behaviors: Controversial Expos√©: Known for his no-nonsense, aggressive style of exposing government corruption and criminality on his program. Part of the prominent Tulfo family in media and politics.

education: Journalist and Broadcaster.
career_timeline: Journalist and Broadcaster. Secretary, DSWD (2022‚Äì2023). Senator of the Philippines (2025‚ÄìPresent). Elected Senator in the 2025 elections. Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Social Welfare and Direct Service: Platforms emphasize direct social assistance and poverty alleviation, based on his experience providing direct aid on air and as DSWD Secretary. OFW Welfare: Focus on protecting OFWs from abuse and fraud.
past_behaviors: Electoral Success: Topped the senatorial race in the 2025 elections, a major victory for an independent candidate. Public Service: His tenure as DSWD Secretary was marked by efforts to quickly disburse financial aid to the poor.

education: Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering (Map√∫a Institute of Technology).
career_timeline: President, Consumer Rights for Safe Energy (CRSE); Transport Leader. Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Consumer Protection and Energy: Focuses on lowering electricity and fuel costs by repealing the Oil Deregulation Law and pushing for lower taxes on essential goods. Transport: Supports the rights of transport groups against modernization programs.
past_behaviors: Activism: Consistently advocates for the consumers against high prices and the interests of oil companies and utility providers.

education: Master in Public Administration (National College of Public Administration and Governance, UP Diliman).
career_timeline: Representative, Catanduanes (Multiple terms). Governor of Catanduanes (2007‚Äì2010). Candidate for Senator (2025) as an Independent.
platforms_and_promises: Local Autonomy: Advocates for strengthening local government units (LGUs) and granting more financial and political power to provinces and municipalities. Disaster Resilience: Focus on improving disaster risk reduction and management, stemming from his experience in a typhoon-prone province.
past_behaviors: Electoral History: Known for his political career in Catanduanes, focusing on regional development and local governance.

education: Bachelor of Science in Business Management (Ateneo de Manila University). Master in Business Administration (IESE Business School, University of Navarra, Spain).
career_timeline: Representative, Las Pi√±as Lone District (2019‚Äì2025). Managing Director, Vista Land. Candidate for Senator (2025) under Nacionalista Party (NP).
platforms_and_promises: Livelihood and MSME Support: Focuses on creating jobs and providing financial assistance and capital for small businesses. Digitalization: Advocates for programs to improve internet access and digital literacy nationwide.
past_behaviors: Political Dynasty: Daughter of former Senate President Manny Villar and Senator Cynthia Villar. Her legislative work has primarily focused on economic recovery and support for micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs).
